v3.13 -> RapidJSON Crashes in Release mode on Android
data.body:
NDK: r12b
API-LEVEL: 11 <also occurs in other api levels>

Rapidjson's memory allocation functions crash every time when compiled in release mode. Fix is to use custom types instead of rapidjson::Document and rapidjson::Value.

``` c++
typedef rapidjson::GenericDocument<rapidjson::UTF8<>, rapidjson::CrtAllocator> RapidJsonDocument;
typedef rapidjson::GenericValue<rapidjson::UTF8<>, rapidjson::CrtAllocator> RapidJsonValue;
```

data.title: fixed #16490: [android, audio] AudioEngine::stop() triggers 'finished' callback
[android, audio] AudioEngine::stop() triggers 'finished' callback

Reported at http://forum.cocos.com/t/cocos2d-x-3-13-android-audioengine-stop/39432
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13
- devices test on: Android
- developing environments
  - NDK version: r10e

Steps to Reproduce:
1. NewAudioEngineTest -> ControlTest
2. Click play, then click stop button
3. finished callback will be triggered

data.title: Issue 16471
data.body:
fix: Label updateColor() and underline color work as expected
fixes Github issue #15214 correctly. underline uses _displayColor
and not _textColorF. _textColorF is only for the text.
This also emulates the SystemFont underline behavior

fixes Github issue #16471

data.title: Memory leaks found in the Zlib library
Fix memory leak when loading Cocos Studio file
data.body:
Another leak found by cppcheck.

In [line 64](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/blob/v3/tools/simulator/libsimulator/lib/runtime/RuntimeCCSImpl.cpp#L64) of RuntimeCCSImpl.cpp a new tinyxml2::XMLDocument is allocated when loading a Cocos Studio file, but the allocated memory is never deleted.

data.title: fix: Label updateColor() and underline color work as expected
data.body:
fixes Github issue #15214 correctly. underline uses _displayColor
and not _textColorF. _textColorF is only for the text.
This also emulates the SystemFont underline behavior

fixes Github issue #16471

data.title: v3.13 -> apps crashing if they don't specify a design resolution

milestone.description: fix bugs are critical in v3.13

data.body:
Apps are crashing if not using a Design resolution:
http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/cocos2d-x-3-13-crashes-when-not-using-design-resolution/31756/6

user posted a work around of: 

```
Director::getInstance()->getOpenGLView()->setContentScaleFactor(1.0f);
Director::getInstance()->getOpenGLView()->setDesignResolutionSize(Director::getInstance()->getOpenGLView()->getFrameSize().width, Director::getInstance()->getOpenGLView()->getFrameSize().height, ResolutionPolicy::EXACT_FIT);
```

data.title: Fix MessageBox inverted params on Android
data.body:
Minor issue here:

**CCCommon-android** invokes:
    JniHelper::callStaticVoidMethod("org/cocos2dx/lib/Cocos2dxHelper", "showDialog", pszMsg, pszTitle);

... while _showDialog_ expects the following signature: showDialog(final String pTitle, final String pMessage)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Call MessageBox("Message", "Title")
2. It will display message and title switched.

(tested on v3.12)

data.title: Building without CHIPMUNK
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version:
  3.13 (current)
- devices test on:
  linux

In CMakeLists.txt i have:

```
# libcocos2d
SET(BUILD_CPP_EMPTY_TEST OFF CACHE BOOL "turn off build cpp-empty-test")
SET(BUILD_CPP_TESTS OFF CACHE BOOL "turn off build cpp-tests")
SET(BUILD_LUA_LIBS OFF CACHE BOOL "turn off build lua related targets")
SET(BUILD_LUA_TESTS OFF CACHE BOOL "Build TestLua samples")
SET(BUILD_JS_LIBS OFF CACHE BOOL "turn off build js related targets")
SET(BUILD_JS_TESTS OFF CACHE BOOL "Build TestJS samples")
# Turn off not needed!
SET(USE_CHIPMUNK OFF CACHE BOOL "Use chipmunk for physics library")
SET(USE_BOX2D OFF CACHE BOOL "Use box2d for physics library")
SET(USE_BULLET OFF CACHE BOOL "Use bullet for physics3d library")
SET(USE_RECAST OFF CACHE BOOL "Use Recast for navigation mesh")
ADD_SUBDIRECTORY(${COCOS2D_ROOT})
```

When i;m building with this configuration everything is fine. App compiles and runs. 
BUT

I just use in my code `TMXTiledMap` and everything is ok on 2 PC but on 2 other PC i have problem that:

```
_map = TMXTiledMap::create("nodpi/level-map.tmx");
_map->getTileSize().width // returns 0
```

When i debug code i see in `TMXTiledMap::_tileSize` has correct values. But when calling `TMXTiledMap::getTileSize()` it return odd stuff. When i switched order in class of this member (before `_mapSize` ) when i call `getTileSize` i get `_mapSize` ...

To fix this i must remove `SET(USE_CHIPMUNK OFF CACHE BOOL "Use chipmunk for physics library")`

But why... ? Any solution for this? Bug is because position depended code ?

data.title: Fix MenuItemSprite::unselected() on disabled items
data.body: Calling MenuItemSprite::unselected() on a disabled item makes it show _normalImage instead of _disabledImage.

Deadlock if preload the same file more than 3 times in preload callback
AudioMixerController::initTrack should not setState for track. Otherwise, it may trigger Track state mess-up.

data.title: Remove deprecated attribute on Node::_setLocalZOrder() function to avoid deprecation warnings
data.body:
Hi, I'm getting this warning message with the recent build and Xcode 7.3.1 since v3.13.

```
cocos/2d/CCNode.cpp:259:5: '_setLocalZOrder' is deprecated
cocos/2d/CCNode.cpp:1136:12: '_setLocalZOrder' is deprecated
cocos/2d/CCNode.cpp:1144:12: '_setLocalZOrder' is deprecated
```

`_setLocalZOrder()` has been deprecated two years ago (since commit https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/commit/31c508ef6de537a55ae73cffc52077f5436dc584), so we should not use it in a core feature of the engine such as `cocos2d::Node`.

This pull request does the following to prevent the warnings:
- Add a new private member function `setLocalZOrderHelper()` instead of `_setLocalZOrder()`
- Replace `_setLocalZOrder()` with `setLocalZOrderHelper()`
- Improve & cleanup documentation comments

Thank you for your time!
